Overwatch 1 was a great title that changed hero shooters back in 2016. Overwatch 2 is a steaming pile of junk. They ruined the balance, limited the game to 5v5 and abandoned the SP content. This game is a shining example (in addition to Diablo 4) of the downfall of Blizzard in the games industry. They ruined this incredible franchise we once had and is now a former shell of itself. Please do not support Blizzard; they can't even support their own harassed employees.

Bought the game on release in 2016 and played off and on since.  I know a lot of folks have their panties in a bunch for this that and the other.  So I will open up with some of that.

New heroes are in the battle pass.  They are instantly unlocked at the first tier if battle pass is bought.  But they are unlocked for free on down.  And if you miss their release season doing some challenges will let you earn them.  But once a new hero comes out they aren't playable in comp for another while.  The hardcore folks will have the free one unlocked or be close to it by the time they are playable in comp.  Also, the new hero is usually open to play battle pass unlock or not in various modes.  No one is restricted from checking em out.  Yeah, it sucks but it's not as bad as a lot of folks are making it out to be.  And all the talk about team synergy and having options is kind of meaningless unless you are very good at the game a very high ranked.  Literally everything works in the metal ranks which is where most folks will be and the base roster is good enough.

I was never hyped or excited about the prospect of PvE.  I saw it's cancellation as a sign of relief.  And my hopes are they focus more on content for the PvP.  I know I am in a minority here.  You will see folks saying the PvE was the reason for the 2 next to the name.  I just don't care.  Happy the game is at least getting updated and content seems to be coming steadily.  If one actually played through the content drought what you are getting now is like being treated like a king.

My one complaint is the cosmetics.  20-25$ for a skin is absurd.  15$ would still be way overpriced.  5$ is probably the most reasonable but we are too far apart I feel like they will never come to a price point that is fair.  However, I feel the battle pass for 15$ is fair.  You get quite a lot if you manage to complete it and especially if you compare it to prices in the shop otherwise it's good value.  But it's all just cosmetics and stuff that has no bearing on the gameplay.

Which is super solid.  To this day the best multiplayer fps experience on the market imo.
Very greedy capitalist man...

I played this game back in 2017 and it was great then.

We had lootboxes, yes, but they were effectively free because you would earn them by just playing the game.
There were overpowered characters, yes, but it was balanced because everybody was powerful and had access to all the heroes.
Toxicity in voice chat was there, yes, but the game was a lot more fun because of it.

All of these are gone from Overwatch "2"

The lootboxes were replaced with a Battle Pass and an egregiously overpriced Shop, so now there is no free way to earn things unless you buy into the horrendous challenge system.
Most of the heroes are now a lot less powerful, unless they are earned through the Battle Pass, meaning you have to give Blizzard your money if you want to win the games you play.
Voice Chat is now monitored constantly and you will be banned for saying anything out of line, and keep in mind that there is no clause stating where your voice data is going.

And the biggest offense of all:

The PvE, the whole reason Overwatch "2" exists, the whole reason Overwatch 1 was left to rot in an updateless hellhole, was cancelled because it was "too hard" even though this had been in the works for several years.

This is not Overwatch "2", this is a shop update.
pain

[h1]This just makes me miss OW1[/h1]

They basically EoS'd OW1 and sh*t out an F2P micro transaction infested cash grab to capitalize on the fun and success of OW1. 

If you're looking for the original fun of OW1 [b]it's still here...[/b] but it just feels so tainted what with the battle pass system and chopped up PvE mission content.

It's like seeing the pure and innocent person you fell in love with sell themselves on the street corner for cigarettes and booze. [i]The person you love is still in there somewhere, but you know they've changed for the worse and can never truly go back to the way they were before.[/i]

So it's up to you whether you go to that person on the street corner, smokes and booze in hand, a deep feeling of guilt in your gut like the one in mine.

I have been playing Overwatch for a very long time. Had over 2000 Lootboxes unopened and at the end of the day while very flawed it was a game with a fair item system, that would give you the ability to earn most items for free. Also sometimes it was even fun.

Here we are Overwatch 2 everything costs double from the first, no free items and grinding for any currency takes month to get a single item/the battle pass. Blizzard had tons of examples how to do it better, they even had done it better before taking the first offline. Promised content wont be released and for small parts of the campaign meant to be given out for free you can now pay. Oh and heroes that when first released are almost needed in a team either require many hours or (again) money.

A sequel releasing completly removing the first part (so you cant play it no more), also removing several features as well as content and not even running at all when first released is just amazing. No one should spend money on a company like this when all they do is charge you and constantly not deliver either promised or needed content. Even without all that they have no clue how to balance characters but hey at least with the steam release you can now tell them how you think about this game.

Blizzard doesn't care about the game, they just want more money. They took away the old game that you had to pay for and replaced it with a new free game that is exactly the same, except: they removed some maps, some gamemodes, even a whole player slot on each team. And what was given back in return? What do they use to justify the "2" in the title and taking away the game people have already paid for? They give one of the worst gamemodes i've played in any game with babysitting the robot, a few new characters which will take at least 210 wins(35 wins per character times 6) to unlock all of them, encouraging you heavily to have to pay blizzard money to buy the characters, which have been nd will likely always be META, and a PvE story mode that will be coming out after TF2 gets it's heavy update(i.e. Never, it was cancelled). And now, because of the backlash, they're releasing paid PvE content on the same level as the free seasonal events from the first game(mediocre to passable for the first 20 minutes, and just a slog after).

If you're coming into this franchise as a fresh player, who only cares about the PvP, it'll be a few hundred game long grind before you get all the characters from the first game. If you're here for the PvE content, go play Deeprock Galactic, Dungeon Defenders, Left 4 Dead 2, Payday 2, or even TF2's free Mann vs Machine mode, all for less money. Or, if you are fine with spending a little more, go pick up a copy of Black Ops 3 zombies chronicles, it'll give you a ton of maps to play on, and it has a large pool of high quality community made maps in the steam workshop, or grab Vermintide 2, which is highly replayable and has one of the most fun combat systems i've played with in any game. Hell, even the plants vs zombies fps games give a more fun hero based PvP and PvE experience.

Tldr, don't waste time or money on this game, go play something else, even picking a game at complete random from steam will likely give you a better player experience than this.

downloaded it just to give it a negative review

I bought overwatch back in 2016, and it was a fun experience back then but Blizzard has no clear direction for their game and just allowed the community to dictate balance changes was laughable

PvE got me hyped despite the content drought the first game suffered, but I was looking forward to the PvE because the archives mission were bangers (except storm rising since that was just there to tease sojourn and hype ow2)

I started to notice red flags in the game's development when they released pvp early and made it free to play so they can excuse in implementing the F2P monetization model into its shop.... Jeff Kaplan leaving the company before the release of PvE.... until they said it to our faces in a stream it was entirely cancelled (The road map was only there to let us down easily to show us they got something cooked up.... but I assure you, past season 6 they have no plans what to do in the future lol)

This is why this game deserves the reception its getting at... They promised us a good game with great features and highly replayable missions only for that original vision to be scrapped and its remains sold to us for $15 (and thats only for the first 3 missions, I would've gladly paid $60 to play the 3 missions with my friends if the talent was added)... Dont even get me started about features from Ow1 being added back and they're hyping it up like its a positive thing (Which shouldve been there from the start lmao)

sad thing this game started out strong but due to greedy higher ups and shitty upper management its lesser competition at the time like Paladins outlived this game lol (Tf2 still reigns supreme)
what can i say?, i don't really like the game, played it before on the other store. Not good not bad, just meh. Overwallet 2?

I played Overwatch 1 with my friends and I had a lot of fun over the years. We were all super hyped for Overwatch 2, just to find out it was a glorified F2P "update." One of our favorite games ruined by making it a cash grab. Some of us couldn't even play with our old accounts because our data didn't transfer over to the new blizzard account. I hope you're happy that you didn't give a single shit about your community Blizzard. But those executives needed some pocket change didn't they?
